maxElements.title: Maximum xml elements
maxElements.description: Maximum number of elements allowed in an xml document. Example: <root><a>1</a>2<b></b></root>, document has 3 elements.

maxDepth.title: Maximum xml depth
maxDepth.description: Maximum depth of xml structure. Example: <root><a><b>1</b></a></root>, xml has a depth of 2.

maxLength.title: Maximum xml length
maxLength.description: Maximum number of characters allowed for the whole xml document.

maxAttributesPerElement.title: Maximum attributes per element
maxAttributesPerElement.description: Maximum number of attributes allowed for single XML element.

maxAttributeValueLength.title: Maximum attribute value length
maxAttributeValueLength.description: Maximum length of individual attribute values.

maxChildrenPerElement.title: Maximum children per element
maxChildrenPerElement.description: Maximum number of child elements for a given element. Example: <root><a><b>1</b><c>2</c></a></root>, 'a' element has 2 children.

maxTextValueLength.title: Maximum text value length
maxTextValueLength.description: Maximum length of individual text value.

maxEntities.title: Maximum xml entities
maxEntities.description: Maximum number of entity expansions allowed. XML entities are kind of macros and are vulnerable to entity expansion attacks (see entity expansion)

maxEntityDepth.title: Maximum xml entity depth
maxEntityDepth.description: Maximum depth of nested entity expansions allowed.

allowExternalEntities.title: Allow external entities
allowExternalEntities.description: Allow inclusion of external entities or not. WARNING: XML can be vulnerable to XXE Injection, you should enable this feature only when you can really really trust your consumers.
